Preclinical Efficacy (Lifespan): Large lifespan extension (≥15%) in mammalian models with reproducible findings across multiple studies, OR exceptional extension (≥30%) in conserved model organisms with reproducible findings.
Preclinical Efficacy (Healthspan): Broad, robust improvements across multiple (≥3) healthspan domains demonstrated in multiple mammalian species.
Human Trial Evidence: High-certainty evidence from multiple, large, low-risk-of-bias RCTs showing a clinically meaningful benefit on an age-related indication; FDA-approved for a relevant chronic condition.
Mechanism Conservation: Core pathway components and function are ubiquitously conserved across all eukaryotes, with clear orthologs and functional equivalence.
Safety & Tolerability (in Humans): FDA-approved for a chronic condition with decades of widespread use (>10M patients). Side effect profile is well-characterized, predominantly mild, and non-life-threatening. No black box warnings.
Cost & Accessibility: Very low cost (<$1/day). Widely available over-the-counter or as a generic drug. Simple oral administration.

Preclinical Efficacy (Lifespan): Significant (≥10%) median lifespan extension in multiple independent studies in mammalian species, OR Interventions showing high magnitude (≥20%) in single mammalian studies.
Preclinical Efficacy (Healthspan): Broad, robust improvements across two healthspan domains demonstrated in at least one mammalian species.
Human Trial Evidence: Moderate-certainty evidence from at least one large, low-risk-of-bias RCT or multiple smaller RCTs showing a clinically meaningful benefit.
Mechanism Conservation: Pathway is highly conserved across all vertebrates with clear functional equivalence in key regulatory nodes.
Safety & Tolerability (in Humans): Long-term use for a chronic condition in large populations (>1M patients). Side effects are well-known, mostly mild-to-moderate, and reversible.
Cost & Accessibility: Low cost (<$5/day). Available as a generic prescription drug. Simple oral administration.

Preclinical Efficacy (Lifespan): Moderate to robust lifespan extension (5-10%) in mammalian models with strong reproducibility, OR substantial extension (10-20%) in mammalian models from single landmark studies.
Preclinical Efficacy (Healthspan): Consistent improvements demonstrated in one major healthspan domain in mammalian models.
Human Trial Evidence: Low-certainty evidence from small or moderate-risk-of-bias RCTs suggesting a benefit on a primary aging/healthspan endpoint.
Mechanism Conservation: Pathway is conserved across metazoans, though some components may have diverged.
Safety & Tolerability (in Humans): Approved for a chronic condition with a well-understood safety profile. Common side effects are moderate but manageable. Low incidence of serious adverse events (SAEs).
Cost & Accessibility: Moderate cost (<$20/day). Available as a branded prescription drug with good insurance coverage.

Preclinical Efficacy (Lifespan): Modest lifespan extension (0-5%) in mammalian models with reproducibility, OR moderate effects (5-10%) in single mammalian studies, OR substantial effects in invertebrate models (5-10%), OR effects observed only in transgenic/progeroid models.
Preclinical Efficacy (Healthspan): Positive effects on multiple healthspan metrics reported, but results are not yet replicated, or broad improvements only in invertebrate models.
Human Trial Evidence: Very low-certainty evidence from high-risk-of-bias RCTs or observational studies for surrogate endpoints.
Mechanism Conservation: Pathway is conserved in mammals, but its role in invertebrates is unclear or different.
Safety & Tolerability (in Humans): Used clinically for an acute or intermittent indication. Side effects can be significant but are predictable and manageable in a clinical setting.
Cost & Accessibility: High cost (<$100,000/year). Requires specialist prescription and monitoring. May require injection or infusion.

Preclinical Efficacy (Lifespan): Inconsistent, or evidence suggests negative/null effect.
Preclinical Efficacy (Healthspan): Inconsistent or modest healthspan improvements in mammals, or evidence suggests negative/null effect. No direct evidence.
Human Trial Evidence: No human trials completed or planned. Only preclinical or observational data exists.
Mechanism Conservation: Pathway is specific to a particular lineage or its role in aging is highly speculative.
Safety & Tolerability (in Humans): Significant safety concerns based on mechanism of action. High potential for severe, irreversible side effects. Known toxicity in humans.
Cost & Accessibility: Prohibitively high cost (>$100,000/year). Complex administration (e.g., gene therapy). Highly restricted access.
